meanings.definition: To withdraw from a position or occupation, typically due to age or health.
meanings.sent1: After many years of hard work, the old man finally retires from his job.
meanings.sent2: My grandfather plans to retire next year after working at the factory for decades.
meanings.sent3: The tired teacher jokingly announces she will retire to a tropical island and never grade papers again.
meanings.sent4: As the sun sets, the weary sailor retires to his cabin, ready to rest after a long day at sea.
meanings.sent5: The CEO's decision to retire caught everyone by surprise, leaving the company in search of a new leader.

meanings.definition: To go to bed or rest for the night.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of hiking, I can't wait to retire to my cozy sleeping bag.
meanings.sent2: The children were told to retire early so they could be well-rested for the big day ahead.
meanings.sent3: The tired puppy happily retires to its bed, dreaming of chasing squirrels in the park.
meanings.sent4: As the clock struck midnight, Cinderella had to retire from the ball, leaving behind her glass slipper.
meanings.sent5: Feeling exhausted, the marathon runner decided to retire to his hotel room for a good night's sleep.

meanings.definition: To move back or away from a place.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers were ordered to retire from the battlefield to regroup and strategize.
meanings.sent2: As the storm approached, the birds began to retire to safer areas in search of shelter.
meanings.sent3: The shy rabbit would retire to its burrow whenever it sensed danger nearby.
meanings.sent4: The sun starts to set, signaling the time for the animals to retire to their dens for the night.
meanings.sent5: The explorer had to retire from the cave as the narrow passage became too dangerous to continue.
